com.blukii.sdk.config

Class SmartKey

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blukii.sdk.config.Blukii
      • com.blukii.sdk.config.SmartKey

  • public final class SmartKey
extends Blukii
    This class represents a blukii of type SmartKey and is the main controller class for connection based communication with blukii devices of that type.

    This class contains additional requests that are specific for blukii SmartKeys.

    To quick start please follow the instructions of the quick start documentation of base class Blukii

    • Method Detail

      • readMode

        public void readMode(@NonNull
                     ResponseListener responseListener)
        Reads the security mode of the SmartKey.

        Values:

        • SETTING_MODE_ERROR
        • SETTING_MODE_OFF
        • SETTING_MODE_CONVENIENCE
        • SETTING_MODE_PAIRING
        • SETTING_MODE_SECURE_PREPARED
        • SETTING_MODE_SECURE

        ResponseData: BlukiiDataItem Type - Integer

        Parameters:
        responseListener - ResponseListener on which callbacks onResponse, onError or onNotify are called
        See Also:
        resetMode(ResponseListener), writeModeConvenience(ResponseListener), writeModePairing(int, ResponseListener), writeModeSecure(int, ResponseListener), BlukiiAction.SmartKeyReadMode

      • resetMode

        public void resetMode(@NonNull
                      ResponseListener responseListener)
        Resets the security mode to SETTING_MODE_OFF.

        On this mode the SmartKey is sending connectable advertising frames.

        It is recommended to use this mode for changing general Bluetooth or blukii settings (see requests of base class Blukii).

        Note: This request is only available in service mode that is running 30 seconds after re-inserting the battery.

        ResponseData: BlukiiDataItem Type - Integer

        Parameters:
        responseListener - ResponseListener on which callbacks onResponse, onError or onNotify are called
        See Also:
        readMode(ResponseListener), BlukiiAction.SmartKeyResetMode

      • writeModeConvenience

        public void writeModeConvenience(@NonNull
                                 ResponseListener responseListener)
        Sets the security mode to SETTING_MODE_CONVENIENCE.

        On this mode the SmartKey is sending nonconnectable advertising frames so you only can connect in service mode (see below).

        Use this mode for low security: the master can identify the blukii by reading the advertising packages.

        Note: This request is only available in service mode that is running 30 seconds after re-inserting the battery.

        ResponseData: BlukiiDataItem Type - Integer

        Parameters:
        responseListener - ResponseListener on which callbacks onResponse, onError or onNotify are called
        See Also:
        readMode(ResponseListener), BlukiiAction.SmartKeyWriteModeConvenience

      • writeModePairing

        public void writeModePairing(int pairingKey,
                             @NonNull
                             ResponseListener responseListener)
        Sets the security mode to SETTING_MODE_PAIRING.

        Use this mode for medium security: the master can identify the blukii by doing the following steps:

        • Ensure master and blukii are paired
        • Connect to blukii
        • Try to authenticate (see initiateAuthentication(ResponseListener) for more information)

        On pairing mode the communication is encrypted by the pairing key.

        It is recommended to call Blukii.initiatePairing(ResponseListener) after running this request and to release the connection.

        Note: This request is only available in service mode that is running 30 seconds after re-inserting the battery.

        ResponseData: BlukiiDataItem Type - Integer

        Parameters:
        pairingKey - 6-digit pairing key (000000 - 999999)
        responseListener - ResponseListener on which callbacks onResponse, onError or onNotify are called
        See Also:
        readMode(ResponseListener), initiateAuthentication(ResponseListener), Blukii.initiatePairing(ResponseListener), BlukiiAction.SmartKeyWriteModePairing

      • writeModeSecure

        public void writeModeSecure(int pairingKey,
                            @NonNull
                            ResponseListener responseListener)
        Sets the security mode to SETTING_MODE_SECURE.

        Use this mode for high security: the master can identify the blukii by doing the following steps:

        • Ensure master and blukii are paired
        • Connect to blukii
        • Try to authenticate (see initiateAuthentication(ResponseListener) for more information)

        On secure mode the communication is encrypted by the pairing key and an additional cryptographic key exchange.

        It is recommended to call Blukii.initiatePairing(ResponseListener) after running this request and to release the connection.

        Note: This request is only available in service mode that is running 30 seconds after re-inserting the battery.

        ResponseData: BlukiiDataItem Type - Integer

        Parameters:
        pairingKey - 6-digit pairing key (000000 - 999999)
        responseListener - ResponseListener on which callbacks onResponse, onError or onNotify are called
        See Also:
        readMode(ResponseListener), initiateAuthentication(ResponseListener), Blukii.initiatePairing(ResponseListener), BlukiiAction.SmartKeyWriteModeSecure

      • initiateAuthentication

        public void initiateAuthentication(@NonNull
                                   ResponseListener responseListener)
        Initiates the authentication in pairing and secure mode.

        The authentication depends on the actual SmartKey security mode:

        • Pairing mode: the master is sending a pairing key encrypted authentication request.
        • Secure mode: the master is requesting the authentication by a multi-stage challenge response process. The communication is encrypted by the cryptographic key that has been set in background by calling writeModeSecure(int, ResponseListener).
        • Convenience mode: no authentication supported.

        Note: Master and SmartKey have to be paired.

        ResponseData: BlukiiDataItem Type - null

        Parameters:
        responseListener - ResponseListener on which callbacks onResponse, onError or onNotify are called
        See Also:
        readMode(ResponseListener), writeModePairing(int, ResponseListener), writeModeSecure(int, ResponseListener), BlukiiAction.SmartKeyInitiateAuthentication

      • readButton

        public void readButton(@NonNull
                       ResponseListener responseListener)
        Reads the actual state of the SmartKey button.

        Note: This request is only valid, if the SmartKey is successfully authenticated.

        ResponseData: BlukiiDataItem Type - Boolean

        Parameters:
        responseListener - ResponseListener on which callbacks onResponse, onError or onNotify are called
        See Also:
        writeButton(int, ResponseListener), BlukiiAction.SmartKeyReadButton

      • writeButton

        public void writeButton(int frames,
                        @NonNull
                        ResponseListener responseListener)
        Writes the number of advertised SmartKey button flags.

        If the SmartKey button is pushed, a corresponding flag is set on the SmartKey advertising frame. Use this request for setting the amount of frame that will contain this flag.

        ResponseData: BlukiiDataItem Type - Integer

        Parameters:
        frames - amount of frames with activate SmartKey button flag.
        responseListener - ResponseListener on which callbacks onResponse, onError or onNotify are called
        See Also:
        readButton(ResponseListener), BlukiiAction.SmartKeyWriteButton
